ISSUE.TITLE: typo in example code from "Evaluating Named Entity Recognition parsers" blog
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: **Describe the bug** Typo in sample code from https://labelstud.io/blog/Evaluating-Named-Entity-Recognition-parsers-with-spaCy-and-Label-Studio.html: > texts = df['line_test'] should be > texts = df['line_text'] That is, the wrong key _line_te**s**t_ is used for data frame column. **To Reproduce** Try to run the sample code from the above blog. **Expected behavior** After running the script, there should be the the two files tasks.json and lines_clean.csv. **Environment (please complete the following information):** - OS: Ubuntu 18.04.5 LTS - Label Studio Version: 1.1.0 **Additional context** - Although technically not part of the code base, this seems to be the best example for doing non-trivial NLP with Label Studio.

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: [fix] Project permission in reimport API (#1280) Co-authored-by: nik <nik@heartex.net>

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Update Evaluating-Named-Entity-Recognition-parsers-with-spaCy-and-Label-Studio.md Fix typo identified in issue #1277
Update Evaluating-Named-Entity-Recognition-parsers-with-spaCy-and-Label-Studio.md (#1286) Fix typo identified in issue #1277
